ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Lots of self-discipline and time management. Do not take this course if you are not able to do those things. Also - it is intensive, so make sure you like the topic that you choose. If you do - you are golden and it can be one of the most fulfilling courses you take at Yale.
Independent research was one of the best decisions I made at Yale.
Yes. Well, it is required, and it is a great way to bring together your research and writing abilities gained over the course of your Yale education.

The year-long senior essay in political science is not only longer but fundamentally different from a shorter seminar paper. In order to ensure that you have enough original data (whether qualitative or quantitative) to merit a year-long essay, you ought to begin research over the summer (or in previous summers/years). Also, I would strongly encourage you to find an advisor who matches not only your topic area of interest but also your temperament, as regards initiative/procrastination. Finally, begin writing before you feel you have a coherent essay to churn out - it will help immensely in refining your ideas.

I recommend Political Science 491 to a fellow student only if you are determined to work one on one with an advisor for a full year (if you're doing the yearlong senior thesis) and have a pre-established relationship with your advisor. I, for one, definitely recommend it!
